author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is criticizing the Liberal government for not committing to the delivery of a budget this year, saying the move could spook investors and send a negative message to credit rating agencies. “It will send a bad signal to investors and ratings agencies, and a lot of people will wonder what the […]
title: Poilievre Says Lack of Budget Sends ‘Bad Signal’ to Investors, Ratings Agencies

author: Chandra Philip
description: Owners of a B.C. ostrich farm say lots of people have been stopping by the farm to prevent the culling of the ostriches after the family lost its court case to save the birds against the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA). The government agency ordered the culling over concerns of avian flu, while the farm […]
title: Protesters Gather to Save BC Ostrich Farm Birds After Court Dismisses Case Against Culling Due to Avian Flu

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Donald Trump in UAE, Fire in Abidjan, and Colorful Village

author: The Canadian Press
description: U.S. attorneys have filed sentencing submissions for two men convicted after a family froze to death while trying to walk across the Canada-U.S. border in Manitoba. A Minnesota jury found Steve Shand and Harshkumar Patel guilty of human-smuggling charges after the parents and two children from India were found in the snow in January 2022. […]
title: Prosecutors Seek Prison for Men Guilty of Human Smuggling in Manitoba Border Deaths

author: Catherine Yang
description: The United States and China are Colombia's biggest trade partners.
title: US Moving to Block Funding for Chinese Projects in Colombia After Nation Joins BRI

author: The Canadian Press
description: Hudson’s Bay is getting a second life with a new owner—Canadian Tire Corp. Ltd. Canadian Tire said Thursday that it will pay $30 million for intellectual property belonging to the retailer, which is Canada’s oldest company. The sale includes the overarching Hudson’s Bay brand, its iconic, multi-coloured stripes motif, its coat of arms and other […]
title: Hudson’s Bay to Sell Name, Stripes, Brands to Canadian Tire for $30 Million

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Alberta government has amended its proposed referendum legislation to make it clear that citizen-initiated petitions cannot infringe on the treaty rights of indigenous peoples. The amendments respond to feedback from First Nations and indigenous partners and are intended to “reassert” the province’s commitment to protecting treaty rights in the event of a citizen-initiated referendum, […]
title: Alberta Revises Referendum Bill to ‘Reassert’ Treaty Rights Commitment

author: Chandra Philip
description: The provincial director of police services independently initiated a request for an investigation into the leak of a health ministry document suggesting ‘safe supply’ drugs were being trafficked, B.C. Premier David Eby says, noting the government cannot interfere in the RCMP probe. B.C. Conservative MLA Elenore Sturko released the document publicly in February after a […]
title: BC Premier Eby Says Government Can’t Interfere in RCMP Probe of Leaked ‘Safe Supply’ Document

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with independent energy consultant Kathryn Porter who says Britain is at severe risk of blackouts. Porter explains how the move to more and more renewables is behind this risk, as they are unstable and not as compatible with our current grid as traditional power sources. She also explains why renewable […]
title: We Spent £220 Billion on Decarbonisation and Saw Zero Financial Benefits: Kathryn Porter

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says Honda Canada’s CEO assured her that no Canadian jobs will be lost or modified, despite the company delaying $15 billion in electric vehicle (EV) investments in the country. Joly said in a statement posted to social media on May 14 that she spoke with Honda Canada President and CEO Dave […]
title: Honda Still Committed to EV Investments in Canada After Delaying $15 Billion Project: Industry Minister

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Lower-level Russian and Ukrainian teams were set to meet in Istanbul as both leaders opted out, while Trump said only a meeting with Putin can end the deadlock.
title: Putin Skips Turkey Peace Talks, Zelenskyy Also Backs Out

author: Olivia Gomm
description: RCMP in Nova Scotia have arrested a man who was the subject of an emergency alert issued to residents in the province’s Lunenburg County on May 14. Richard MacInnis, 44, of Nova Scotia, was wanted by police on a Canada-wide arrest warrant for violating parole conditions, and was believed to be armed at the time […]
title: Nova Scotia Man Wanted on Nationwide Warrant Arrested After Emergency Alert

author: Marco Navarro-Génie
description: Canada has energy the world is begging for, but ideology and red tape are holding us back.
title: It’s Time Canada Saw Energy as Power, Not as a Liability

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The U.S. delegation will honor the first American-born pontiff to lead the Catholic Church.
title: Vance, Rubio to Attend Pope Leo XIV’s Inauguration Mass at Vatican

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Supreme Court of Canada will not review the Toronto Catholic District School Board’s decision to sanction a trustee over comments he made during a debate. At a November 2019 public meeting of trustees, the board considered a motion to add four new grounds for barring discriminatory practices: gender identity, gender expression, family status and […]
title: Supreme Court Won’t Review School Board’s Decision to Sanction Trustee Over Remarks

author: The Canadian Press
description: Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew declared a state of emergency Thursday to aid the evacuation of a provincial park due to wildfires, one day after the bodies of two people were discovered. He did not provide more details about the man and woman who died in the fire in the Rural Municipality of Lac du Bonnet. […]
title: Manitoba Declares State of Emergency in Provincial Park Due to Fires

author: Michael Wing
description: Humans may be luminous beings—literally—according to researchers at the University of Calgary who authored a new study. Examining mice and plants, the researchers in a cross-disciplinary study found tiny amounts of light are being emitted from living specimens as part of their metabolism. The study suggests all lifeforms, including human beings, have a similar “glow” […]
title: Living Things ‘Glow’ With an Invisible Light, Calgary Researchers Find

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe has released a letter addressed to Prime Minister Mark Carney detailing 10 policy changes he says Ottawa must implement to restore the relationship between the federal government and his province. The letter posted to Moe’s social media account on May 14 outlines the province’s “Strong Saskatchewan, Strong Canada Plan.” “The PM […]
title: Premier Moe Calls for 10 Changes From Ottawa to ‘Reset’ Its Relationship With Sask.

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Bloc Québécois says it will challenge the federal election results in the Quebec riding of Terrebonne, which the Liberals won by one vote following a judicial recount. “We intend to undertake legal proceedings to ask the courts to order the rerun of the election in the riding of Terrebonne, and to do that as […]
title: Bloc Pursuing Legal Challenge After Losing Quebec Riding to Liberals by a Single Vote

author: Guy Birchall
description: Europe's two largest economies will work together on the 'precision strike' system, which will have a range of more than 1,200 miles.
title: UK and Germany to Jointly Develop New Strike Weapon

author: Rachel Roberts
description: UK will no longer be seen as 'global charity,' according to Baroness Jenny Chapman, who denied that Labour is following the lead of the U.S. DOGE.
title: Gender and Education Funding Scaled Back in Foreign Aid Cuts But Vaccine Programmes Stay

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Flexible working benefits remain concentrated in London and the southeast, researchers say.
title: Remote Work Fails to Bridge Regional Divide, Study Finds

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The Royal College of Emergency Medicine's president said the figures were 'the equivalent of two aeroplanes crashing every week.'
title: Excess Deaths Linked to Long A&E Waits Increased by 20 Percent, Medics Estimate

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: CBC/Radio-Canada has announced it will no longer give out millions of dollars in executive and employee bonuses, but will increase salaries to “attract and retain the talent it requires to be successful.” The public broadcaster’s board of directors made the decision to eliminate what it describes as “performance pay” after receiving the “advice and concurrence” […]
title: CBC Scraps Executive and Staff Bonuses, Increases Salaries as Compensation

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump delivers remarks to troops at Al Udeid Air Base, Qatar, on May 15.
title: Trump Delivers Remarks to Troops at Al Udeid Air Base, Qatar

author: Alicia Márquez
description: Beijing-based Poly Technologies is sanctioned by the United States.
title: Nicaragua Announces Military Contract With State-Owned Chinese Company

author: Katabella Roberts
description: The DHS says the toddler's father is a gang member 'who oversees homicides, drug sales, kidnappings, extortion, sex trafficking, and operates a torture house.'
title: Toddler Separated From Parents in Deportation Case Is Reunited With Mother in Venezuela

author: The Canadian Press
description: Jury selection is beginning in the trial of a man charged with killing three people with a truck in eastern Quebec. Forty-year-old Steeve Gagnon faces five charges, including three counts of first-degree murder and two counts of attempted murder. Gagnon turned himself in to police after a truck struck pedestrians on a main street of […]
title: Trial Begins for Quebec Man Facing First-Degree Murder Charges in 2023 Truck Attack

author: Owen Evans
description: A sudden increase in wind speed caused the yacht to heel over to 90 degrees in less than 15 seconds, putting it in an 'irrecoverable' situation.
title: Extreme Winds Likely Toppled Mike Lynch’s Superyacht Off Sicily, Interim UK Report Finds

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The two countries are deepening ties, which will come as a relief to Australia after rumours of Russia seeking to establish a marine base in Indonesia.
title: Facing Russia and China, Australia Invests Millions to Strengthen Ties With Indonesia

author: Reuters
description: MEXICO CITY—At least 21 people died in an auto accident on Wednesday on a highway connecting Mexico’s Oaxaca and Puebla states, a top state official said. In a post on social media, Puebla Interior Minister Samuel Aguilar said the accident involved three vehicles and that an unspecified number of other people were being treated for […]
title: At Least 21 People Dead in Mexico After Multi-Vehicle Highway Accident

author: PA Media
description: The Terminally Ill Adults (End of Life) Bill, which relates to England and Wales, returns to the House of Commons on Friday.
title: Royal College of Physicians Adds Voice of Concern on Assisted Dying Bill

author: Chris Summers
description: The president said he wanted Iran to be a great country but added, 'They can't have a nuclear weapon. ... It's very simple.'
title: Trump Says Negotiators ‘Getting Close’ to Possible Nuclear Deal With Iran

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Liberal senator responds after a transgender student set new records at a South Australian school sports event.
title: Minister Defends Trans Inclusion After Student Breaks Records

author: PA Media
description: GDP increased by 0.7 percent between January and March, the Office for National Statistics said.
title: UK Economy Grows at Fastest Quarterly Rate in a Year in Boost for Reeves

author: Emel Akan
description: Before he visited the military base, Trump joined a business roundtable in Doha on the first state visit by a U.S. president to Qatar.
title: Trump Visits American Troops in Qatar During Middle-East Tour

author: Dorothy Li
description: Despite the announcement of removing non-tariff countermeasures targeting the U.S., China appears to be keeping its export controls on rare earths in place.

description: The government's new emergency services fund will charge homeowners and farmers each year.

description: The prime minister also rejected the 'culture wars' being fought in Australia.

description: The Environmental Defenders Office has been the subject of scrutiny nationally for its troubled legal practices.

description: In a preview of next week's budget, Finance Minister Nicola Willis has revealed the establishment of a $190 million social investment fund.

description: Customers are hiring lawyers and lodging complaints after being questioned on the use of their own income.

description: Waters, who has served in the Senate since 2010, contested the leadership against Senators Mehreen Faruqi and Sarah Hanson-Young.

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The underemployment rate—which measures those working fewer hours than they want—inched up to 6 percent in April.
title: Unemployment Holds at 4.1 Percent as Job Market Absorbs More Workers

author: AAP
description: A former Liberal MP accused of sexually assaulting a teenager is back in police custody after being accused of breaching his bail conditions. Rory Amon, 35, has pleaded not guilty to five charges of sexual intercourse with a person aged 10 to 14. But Amon was arrested on the night of May 14 after police […]
title: Ex-Liberal MP Arrested, Accused of Breaching Bail

author: Alfred Bui
description: Yang Hengjun said the Australian government support in the past six years helped him endure unbearable suffering in CCP prison.
title: ‘Darkest Chapter of My Life’: Australian Blogger’s Plea for Help from Beijing Prison

author: The Associated Press
description: TOKYO—A search was launched on Wednesday for two crew members reported missing after a Japanese air force training plane crashed minutes after take off. The T-4 training plane belonging to the Japan Air Self-Defense Force took off from Komaki Air Base, in the central Japanese prefecture of Aichi, Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshimasa Hayashi said. The […]
title: 2 Crew Members Missing After a Military Training Plane Crashes in Central Japan

author: The Associated Press
description: TOKYO—Nissan is slashing about 15% of its global work force, or about 20,000 employees, as the Japanese automaker reported a loss Tuesday for the fiscal year that just ended amid slipping vehicle sales in China and other nations, and towering restructuring costs. Nissan Motor Corp. said it will reduce the number of its auto plants […]
title: Nissan Slashes 15 Percent of Its Global Work Force as the Japan Automaker Sinks Into Losses

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Financial hardship grievances soar 71.9 percent over last year, driven by inflexible repayment options.
title: Telco Sector Sees 7 Percent Rise in Small Business Complaints

author: Catherine Yang
description: Matthew Galeotti, head of the Justice Department’s Criminal Division, announced a new white-collar crimes enforcement plan at a May 12 financial conference, spotlighting the Trump administration’s focus on disrupting transnational networks that evade U.S. sanctions, tariffs, and immigration law. It also expanded its whistleblower program to cover these priority areas. The DOJ will be pulling […]
title: DOJ Incentivizes Corporate Reporting, Whistleblowing for Sanctions, Tariffs, Immigration Violations

author: Alex Wu
description: Lula’s visit signifies that Beijing has opened a new battlefield in Latin America amid the global blockade by the West, analysts say.
title: Brazilian President Visits China, Signs Tens of Billions in Deals With Beijing

description: Valeria Marquez, 23, had nearly 200,000 followers across Instagram and TikTok.
title: Mexican TikTok Beauty Influencer Fatally Shot During Livestream

description: One of the suspended MPs is the 21-year-old who made worldwide headlines by tearing up the Treaty Principles Bill and leading a haka during Parliament.
title: Māori Party MPs Face Unprecedented Suspension for Haka Protest

author: Cindy Li
description: One conclusion for the Liberal Party's performance is that Chinese voters were concerned about the ties between Canberra and Beijing.
title: Does Standing up to the CCP Cost Votes?

author: Catherine Yang
description: The Department of Commerce warns entities against using Huawei chips that were developed in violation of U.S. export controls.
title: US Issues Huawei Chips Warning, Signaling New AI Diffusion Rule

author: The Canadian Press
description: The bodies of two people were found in an area northeast of Winnipeg as fast-moving wildfires spurred by dry, hot and windy conditions prompted hundreds to evacuate Wednesday. RCMP said the bodies are believed to be of a man and woman, and that it may take days to confirm their identities. It is believed they […]
title: Man, Woman Found Dead as Crews Battle Wildfire in Manitoba, Police Say

author: Catherine Yang
description: The U.S. Treasury Department on May 14 sanctioned six persons and 12 entities for their involvement in the Iranian regime’s missile program, including groups that are needed by Iran to build its own intercontinental ballistic missiles. “The United States cannot allow Iran to develop intercontinental ballistic missiles,” Secretary of the Treasury Scott Bessent stated, adding […]
title: US Sanctions Iranian, Chinese Entities Involved in Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles Development

author: Carolina Avendano
description: While the recent federal election was mainly a contest between the Liberals and Conservatives, most Canadians say they don’t think the country would be better off with a two-party system, a new poll suggests. Meanwhile, most NDP and Bloc Québécois supporters say they don’t want an election in the next two years. Nearly half of […]
title: Most Canadians Not Keen on a Two-Party System While Third Parties Unlikely to Want an Early Election: Poll
